timeline.title: Week 1: Introduction to Accounting Principles
timeline.description: Start with fundamental accounting concepts and terminology.
tasks: Learn basic accounting equation (Assets = Liabilities + Equity)
Understand the different types of accounts (asset, liability, equity, revenue, expense)
Study the accounting cycle (recording transactions, adjusting entries, closing entries)
Set up a dedicated study space and organize learning materials
Create a detailed weekly study schedule

timeline.title: Week 2: Financial Statements
timeline.description: Focus on preparing and interpreting financial statements.
tasks: Learn how to prepare an income statement, balance sheet, and statement of cash flows
Understand the relationships between the three financial statements
Practice creating financial statements from simple transactions
Begin working through practice problems

timeline.title: Week 3: Cost Accounting
timeline.description: Introduce cost accounting principles and techniques.
tasks: Learn about different costing methods (job order, process costing)
Understand cost behavior (variable, fixed, mixed costs)
Practice calculating cost of goods sold and other cost-related metrics
Review previous topics to reinforce learning

timeline.title: Week 4: Managerial Accounting
timeline.description: Explore managerial accounting concepts and applications.
tasks: Learn about budgeting and forecasting techniques
Understand performance evaluation metrics
Practice applying managerial accounting concepts to case studies
Begin reviewing for potential quizzes/tests

timeline.title: Week 5: Advanced Accounting Topics (I)
tasks: Study inventory valuation methods (FIFO, LIFO, weighted average)
Learn about depreciation methods
Understand accounting for receivables and payables
Continue practicing problems and reviewing materials

timeline.title: Week 6: Advanced Accounting Topics (II)
tasks: Study accounting for long-term assets and liabilities
Learn about accounting for leases and bonds
Understand the basics of auditing and internal controls
Take practice exams to assess understanding

timeline.title: Week 7: Review and Consolidation
timeline.description: Review all topics covered and focus on weaker areas.
tasks: Review all key concepts and formulas
Focus on areas where more understanding is needed
Work through additional practice problems
Start preparing for potential exams

timeline.title: Week 8: Exam Preparation & Practice
tasks: Take full-length practice exams
Review weak areas identified in practice exams
Refine study techniques
Ensure a well-rested and focused exam day

timeline.title: Week 9-12: Continued Study & Exploration (Optional)
timeline.description: Explore specialized areas or prepare for further certifications (if desired).
tasks: Explore areas like tax accounting, forensic accounting, or governmental accounting. Consider pursuing further certifications like CMA or CPA (long-term goal)
Continue working through practice problems and maintaining learned skills
Maintain a consistent study routine

weekly: Adjust study plan based on performance
